definition: the Tang and Wu Revolts: the overthrow (c. 1600 BC) of the Xia Dynasty by the first king, Tang 商湯|商汤[Shang1 Tang1], of the Shang Dynasty, and the overthrow (c. 1046 BC) of the Shang Dynasty by the Zhou Dynasty founder, King Wu 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2]
soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled
animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
